entry.title: Added New "Legacy Website" Category
entry.content: So, yeah. The 2018 website archive now has it’s own category. You can visit here

entry.title: Added Some Really Old Post from 2018!
entry.content:
Thanks to the power of the Wayback Machine, I was able to get back some old, and I mean OLD, post from my website. The link I gave leads back to that archive. 2018 is when I still was working hard on Delta Green, and TheCrafters001 OS. One of those doesn’t exist anymore, but what can I say. It was really more of what I am making with Forest-OE. But, back to the post. I have added them back to my website in the Old News catagory. Anyway, that is all for this post.

Thanks for reading!

entry.title: Why is Pokémon Delta Green Taking So Long To Make?
entry.content:
So… This is a question that has been bothering me for a while. Pokémon Fan Games are hard to make. But I am not making a ROM hack, so why is it taking so long? First is the fact that we really don’t have a story. I mean, the story we DO have is only one and a half pages long. But that is not the only thing that we are tring to figure out, we just also ended up to make the starter (not starters) an Eevee. Don’t beleave me? Here is a snippet of code from the game:

Now, you may have noticed that I keep saying “we” in the post. I am refering to me and Frozentual. Frozentual is the person who builds the trainers’ teams in the game. But if you couldn’t tell, we have no idea what we are doing.

HOW TO WRITE SCRTIPT FOR POKMONE GAME
?!
I ASM SO CIKNFUYSED

@Frozentualtwitter.com/Frozentual/status/1299441089233981440

Another thing.
We are also using a Game Engine that, while it is popular for making fan-games, is hardly used for game development anymore. Don’t get me wrong, RPG Maker XP is a good engine, it is just… “old”. Especially now that the new version of RPG Maker just came out on the 20th. But hey. I like the engine. And now I think it is time to end the post because I am running out of things to talk about.

Thank you for reading.

entry.title: Fixed a bug on the website!
entry.content: There was a bug that caused the twitter embed (on the right) to go ALL the way to the end of my feed, causing the website to look overly extended. Now it should no longer do that, and only extend down 2000px down. Oh, and now there are links on the home page for the software and games categories.

entry.title: Added new Game Updater Page
entry.content: So, I updated the website, and now there is a page for Game Updater. I am adding pages for software, and games that I make, but they are being added slowly, so yeah. Anyways, visit the home page to get to the page!

entry.title: Updated Blog Page
entry.content: Alright. I updated the blog page (the page you are on now) to now update how high the IFrame is when you look at the page. To be honest though, I have no idea if it works. This post was mainly created to test it out.

entry.title: GameJolt is Down till Noon EST 8/21/2020
Welcome to my new website
entry.content: Welcome to my new website! Heavily based on the code from Frozentual’s Website. I think it is nice. It has a True Dark Mode. (The only mode you can use here.) What do you think? I think it is neat. Anyway. Bye. (PS: There is a twitter feed on the Home and Blog pages!)
